```{r load-data}
laptop <- read.csv("data/laptop_data_cleaned.csv") 

# the total number of laptop of each comapny
ggplot(data = laptop, aes(y = Company)) +
  geom_bar()

# the relationship between the company and the price 
ggplot(data = laptop, 
       mapping = aes(y = Price,
                     fill = Company)) +
  geom_histogram() +
  facet_grid( ~Company )

# the relationship between the company and the price ( boxplot ) 
ggplot(data = laptop, 
       mapping = aes(y = Price,
                     fill = Company)) +
  geom_boxplot() +
    facet_grid( ~Company )



# the relationship between the price and the RAM 
ggplot(data = laptop, 
       mapping = aes(y = Price,
                     fill = Ram)) +
  geom_histogram() +
  facet_grid( ~Ram )

# The market share of different Os
ggplot(laptop, aes(
    x = "",
    fill = Os
    )) +
  geom_bar(position = "fill") +
  coord_polar("y", start = 0) +
  theme_void() +
  labs( title = "The market share of different systems( Os )" )

#
ggplot(laptop, 
       mapping = aes(
         x = Weight,   
         y = TypeName
         )) +
  geom_boxplot() +  
  labs(
    x = "Weight",
    y = "TYpe Name",
    title = "The Weight of Different laptop")
```
